MultiFileSystem Class Reference

This class provides an implementation of IFileSystem that reads from several other IFileSystems. More...

Detailed Description

This class provides an implementation of IFileSystem that reads from several other IFileSystems.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

This is the constructor.

This is the destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void MultiFileSystem::addBaseFileSystem ( FileSystemPtr  pFileSystem,
int  index = -1 
)

This method adds a base filesystem to the search path.

FileSystems will be searched in the order they are added. Note that FileSystems are expected to be allocated on the heap, and are owned by this object. They will be freed by the MultiFileSystem when it is destroyed.

Parameters:
pFileSystem Pointer to the FileSystem to add.
index Indicates where to insert the file system in to the current set.

void MultiFileSystem::checkCaseOfPaths ( bool  enable  )  [virtual]

This enables or disables a filename case check.

Parameters:
enable If true then files are checked for correct case in the filename, and if false then files are not checked.

Reimplemented from IFileSystem.

This method returns a IFileSystem pointer to a copy of this object.

a copy of this object

Implements IFileSystem.

void MultiFileSystem::collateFiles ( const std::string &  path,
std::vector< BinaryPtr > &  ret 
) [virtual]

This method reads the contents of a file.

Parameters:
path Path relative to the base of the filesystem.
ret Returned vector of binary blocks

std::string MultiFileSystem::correctCaseOfPath ( const std::string &  path  )  const [virtual]

This corrects the case of the given path by getting the path that the operating system has on disk.

Parameters:
path The path to get the correct case of.
Returns:
The path corrected for case to match what is stored on disk. If the path does not exist then it is returned.

Reimplemented from IFileSystem.

void MultiFileSystem::delBaseFileSystem ( int  index  ) 

This method removes a base file system specified by its index.

bool MultiFileSystem::eraseFileOrDirectory ( const std::string &  path  )  [virtual]

This method erases a given file or directory from the first base file system that it is found in.

Iterate through the base file systems until the given path is found.

Parameters:
path Path relative to the base of the filesystem.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

Implements IFileSystem.

std::string MultiFileSystem::eventTimeToString ( uint64  eventTime  )  [virtual]

This method converts a file event time to a string - only the first file system is asked.

Parameters:
eventTime The file event time to convert.

Implements IFileSystem.

std::string MultiFileSystem::getAbsolutePath ( const std::string &  path  )  const [virtual]

This method resolves the base dependent path to a fully qualified path.

Resolves it based on the first file system.

Parameters:
path Path relative to the base of the filesystem.
Returns:
The fully qualified path.

Implements IFileSystem.

IFileSystem::FileType MultiFileSystem::resolveToAbsolutePath ( std::string &  path  )  const

This method resolves the base dependent path to a fully qualified path.

If returns the full path of the first file-system that has contains the given file (or directory).

Parameters:
path Path relative to the base of the filesystem.
Returns:
The type of the file (or directory) that matched the path.

bool MultiFileSystem::writeFile ( const std::string &  path,
BinaryPtr  pData,
bool  binary 
) [virtual]

This method writes a file to disk.

Iterate through the base file systems until the given path is found.

Parameters:
path Path relative to the base of the filesystem.
pData Data to write to the file
binary Write as a binary file (Windows only)
Returns:
True if successful

Implements IFileSystem.
